sentence.Network_en: Almost from the outset, the extravaganza was beset with difficulties.

sentence.Network_en: They will be laying on liquid refreshment to fortify brides-to-be for the shopping extravaganza ahead.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们将为准新娘们准备些酒，好让她们接下来有充沛精力疯狂购物。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent. (in the sense 'extravagance in language or behaviour'): from Italian estravaganza 'extravagance'. The change was due to association with words beginning with extra-

entry.def: An extravaganza is a very elaborate and expensive show or performance.

means.word_mean: 1. any lavishly staged or spectacular entertainment
